page.title: 16FARMING
page.content:
{1Farming} There are approx.20 different farms in the parish of Snainton with 3 still being on the main street. The farms to the south of the village are on the old Lake Pickering bed and have good fertile land used mainly for the growing of corn. The use of oil seed rape has grown over the last few years. There are some cattle kept. On the rising land to the North of the Village sheep are reared along with corn.Several of the farms have large pig rearing units and some poultry.
In the village there are several {Market Gardens}which supply the Markets in Scarborough and the Holiday Trade.
